Data: Palmer Penguins Measurements for penguin species, island in Palmer Archipelago, size (flipper length, body mass, bill dimensions), and sex. ::: columns ::: {.column width="30%"} ![](images/penguins.png) ::: ::: {.column width="70%"} ::: small ::: {.cell output-location='fragment'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1-2|4"} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` â”€â”€ Attaching core tidyverse packages â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ tidyverse 2.0.0 â”€â”€ âœ” dplyr 1.1.4 âœ” readr 2.1.5 âœ” forcats 1.0.0 âœ” stringr 1.5.1 âœ” ggplot2 3.4.4 âœ” tibble 3.2.1 âœ” lubridate 1.9.3 âœ” tidyr 1.3.1 âœ” purrr 1.0.2 â”€â”€ Conflicts â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ tidyverse_conflicts() â”€â”€ âœ– dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() âœ– dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() â„¹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1-2|4"} library(palmerpenguins) glimpse(penguins) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 344 Columns: 8 $ species Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, Adelie, Adelâ€¦ $ island Torgersen, Torgersen, Torgersen, Torgersen, Torgerseâ€¦ $ bill_length_mm 39.1, 39.5, 40.3, NA, 36.7, 39.3, 38.9, 39.2, 34.1, â€¦ $ bill_depth_mm 18.7, 17.4, 18.0, NA, 19.3, 20.6, 17.8, 19.6, 18.1, â€¦ $ flipper_length_mm 181, 186, 195, NA, 193, 190, 181, 195, 193, 190, 186â€¦ $ body_mass_g 3750, 3800, 3250, NA, 3450, 3650, 3625, 4675, 3475, â€¦ $ sex male, female, female, NA, female, male, female, maleâ€¦ $ year 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007, 2007â€¦ ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ## Goal ::: panel-tabset ### Plot ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=100%} ::: ::: ### Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1|2|3|5|6-13"} ggplot( data = penguins, mapping = aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species) ) + geom_point() + labs( title = "Bill depth and length", subtitle = "Dimensions for Adelie, Chinstrap, and Gentoo Penguins", x = "Bill depth (mm)", y = "Bill length (mm)", color = "Species", caption = "Source: Palmer Station LTER / palmerpenguins package" ) + scale_color_viridis_d() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). ``` ::: ::: ::: # Coding out loud ## Represent each observation with a point and map species to the color of each point. Title the plot "Bill depth and length", add the subtitle "Dimensions for Adelie, Chinstrap, and Gentoo Penguins", label the x and y axes as "Bill depth (mm)" and "Bill length (mm)", respectively, label the legend "Species", and add a caption for the data source. Finally, use a discrete color scale that is designed to be perceived by viewers with common forms of color blindness. ::: ## Argument names ::: callout-tip You can omit the names of first two arguments when building plots with `ggplot()`. ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|2-7"} ggplot( data = penguins, mapping = aes( x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species ) ) + geom_point() + scale_color_viridis_d() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|2-7"} ggplot( penguins, aes( x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, color = species ) ) + geom_point() + scale_color_viridis_d() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). ``` ::: ::: ::: :::
